articles.title: Rank of KPA Vice-Marshal Conferred on Hwang Pyong So
articles.content:
Rank of KPA Vice-Marshal Conferred on Hwang Pyong So
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The rank of vice-marshal of the Korean People's Army (KPA) was conferred on Hwang Pyong So.
					 A relevant decision was issued by the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and the National Defence Commission of the DPRK on April 26.

articles.title: NDC Clarifies Its Principled Stand on Obama's South Korean Junket
articles.content:
NDC Clarifies Its Principled Stand on Obama's South Korean Junket
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Defence Commission of the DPRK issued a statement Monday as regards U.S. President Obama's south Korean junket from April 25 to 26.
					 Obama's trip was nothing but an abnormal burlesque staged at the repeated coquetry and request made by his female stooge driven into a tight corner for her "yusin" fascist rule of modern type and unpopular rule, the statement says, and goes on:
					
					 We do not want to take issue with every disgusting behavior which took place between him and his servant but cannot but take a serious note of his wicked demeanor.
					
					 We gave meaningful advices to Obama to think twice as he is the man responsible for detente and peace on the Korean peninsula before his start of the recent tour.
					
					 During his trip he held summit talks and a joint press conference and inspected the U.S.-south Korea Combined Forces Command, etc. to persistently take issue with the DPRK and hurl the puppet forces into escalating the confrontation with it.
					
					 He called for slapping tougher international "sanctions" and boosting "cooperation in the campaign against the north" and agreed with his south Korean counterpart on building a missile shield and deferring the transfer of the right to control wartime operations under the pretext of the DPRK's nuclear activities and rocket launches for self-defence. This brought to daylight what purpose he sought in his recent tour.
					
					 The NDC of the DPRK clarifies the following principled stand in connection with the fact that the U.S. chief executive responsible for working out and implementing the policy towards the DPRK dared pull up the DPRK and recklessly behaved after flying into south Korea:
					
					 First, the U.S. should deeply repent of its crime-woven past when it inflicted a nuclear disaster on humankind before taking issue with the DPRK's nukes which are for just purposes.
					
					 Obama loudly claimed that the DPRK's nukes are "direct threats" to the U.S. and its allies and vociferously talked about the "theory of not allowing the north's nukes ".
					
					 The nuclear issue, a source of worldwide disaster and trouble, was spawned by the U.S. 
					
					 The DPRK had access to the nukes due to the U.S. constant nuclear threat and blackmailing.
					
					 This not withstanding, the U.S. is shamelessly behaving, hiding its past and practices in which it spawned our nuclear issue. 
					
					 We would like to declare once again that the DPRK's nukes are not to get recognition or permission from someone. It is not a bargaining chip for economic dealings either.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to learn the habit of repenting of itself before pulling up others.
					
					 It had better behave itself, remembering the saying a curse comes home to roost.
					
					 Second, Obama should have thought about the ailing American society and wagged his tongue before talking rubbish about "provocation", "threat" and "human rights" in the DPRK.
					
					 Throughout his trip to south Korea Obama, siding with Park, vociferated about "provocation", "threat" and "human rights" issue in the DPRK.
					
					 We cannot but question him whether he made such tongue lashing, aware of what do the words provocation and threat mean. 
					
					 It is the contention of the U.S. that just self-defense to protect one's inviolable country from foreign invasion means "provocation" and "threat" while its brigandish act of staging saber-rattling in far-off land of other country is a justifiable action. This brought to daylight its practice reminiscent of a guilty party filing the suit first and its behavior making profound confusion of right and wrong. 
					
					 The same is the case with the "human rights" issue of the DPRK.
					
					 Human rights precisely mean sovereignty.
					
					 A man is like dead if he is deprived of independence.
					
					 Neither material affluence nor luxury can replace independence.
					
					This is the truth proven by the long human history and grim reality today.
					
					 The U.S. and its allies should clearly understand that their "human rights" ballad can never bring down the DPRK just as they did in the Mid-east and Balkans.
					
					 Third, the U.S. should remember that its attempt to put the Korean peninsula under its control is an anachronistic act of bringing it shame and destruction.
					
					 This time Obama disclosed his disposition as a wolf which does not let its prey go.
					
					 He forced the south Korean puppet forces to reexamine the period and conditions for the transfer of the right to control wartime operations slated for 2015.
					
					 The U.S. has tried hard to seize the right to control wartime operations at any cost in order to keep hold on south Korea, a strategic stronghold which it occupies for the past nearly seven decades.
					
					 That's why it has trumpeted about the DPRK's "constant threats" and "war deterrence".
					
					 The U.S. attempt to keep its forces in south Korea for an indefinite period is a pipe dream.
					
					 Clear is our stand clarified to the U.S. which does not know at all who its rival is.
					
					 The evermore undisguised hostile moves of the U.S. against the DPRK would only reinforce its retaliatory measures.
					
					 Obama would be well advised to properly face up to the situation, though belatedly, and coolly look back on what he has earned and what he has lost through his vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 We would like to advise once again that he should never miss his opportunity while he remains the boss of the White House.

articles.title: Congratulations from Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Congratulations from Raul Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- First Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from President of the Council of Ministers of Cuba Raul Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State of Cuba on April 24.
					 The message said:
					
					 Respected Comrade,
					
					 I extend warmest congratulations to you on your reelection as first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Please accept my fraternal regards.

articles.title: Russian Deputy PM Here
articles.content:
Russian Deputy PM Here
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, and his party arrived here Monday.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK Vice-Premier and Russian Deputy PM Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK Vice-Premier and Russian Deputy PM Held
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Talks between Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, and Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung, Im Chon Il, consul general of the DPRK in Nakhodka of the Russian Federation, and officials concerned and from the opposite side Yuri Trutnev and his party, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and his embassy officials.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the economic and cooperative relations between the two countries and other issues of mutual concern. 
					
					 Earlier, a tete-a-tete was held between Ro Tu Chol and Yuri Trutnev.

articles.title: DPRK Gov't Gives Reception for Russian Deputy PM
articles.content:
DPRK Gov't Gives Reception for Russian Deputy PM
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government gave a reception in honor of Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
					 Present there on invitation were Yuri Trutnev and his party, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and his embassy officials.
					
					 Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol, Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and officials concerned were on hand.
					
					  Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Russia Donates Fire Engines to DPRK
articles.content:
Russia Donates Fire Engines to DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The government of the Russian Federation donated fire engines to the DPRK.
					 The relevant ceremony was held here on Monday.
					
					 Present there were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Sung Bom, vice-minister of the People's Security and its officials and firemen.
					
					 Also present were Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, and his party on a visit to the DPRK, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and his embassy officials.
					
					The speakers at the ceremony expressed belief that the fire engines associated with warm sincerity and friendship of the Russian people would play a big role in ensuring the security of the Korean people.
					
					 A donation certificate was conveyed and the participants looked round the fire engines.

articles.title: Agreement Signed between DPRK and Russia
articles.content:
Agreement Signed between DPRK and Russia
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- An agreement on trade and economic cooperation was signed between the DPRK ministry of Foreign Trade and the Amur Regional Government of the Russian Federation at the Mansudae Assembly Hall with due ceremony on Monday.
					 Present at the ceremony from the DPRK side were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Im Chon Il, DPRK consul general in Nakhodka of Russia and officials concerned.
					
					 Present from the Russian side were Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, and his party, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and his embassy officials.
					
					 Ri Ryong Nam and Governor of Amur Region Oleg Kozhemyako signed the agreement. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a document on cooperation in railway transport was signed between the Railways Ministry of the DPRK and Mostovik Scientific-Industrial Company of Russia.

articles.title: DPRK Gov't Economic Delegation Leaves for African Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Gov't Economic Delegation Leaves for African Countries
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government economic delegation led by Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Myong San left here Monday to participate in the 4th meeting of the Inter-governmental Joint Committee of the DPRK and Nigeria and to visit various countries of Africa.

articles.title: WAF President Here
articles.content:
WAF President Here
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Ugur Erdener, president of the World Archery Federation arrived here by air on Monday.

articles.title: Delegation of Center for Energy and Security Studies of Russia Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Center for Energy and Security Studies of Russia Leaves
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Center for Energy and Security Studies of Russia headed by Director Anton Khlopkov left here for home on Monday.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Leave
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Leave
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests left here Monday after taking part in the 29th Meeting of General Directors of the Organization of Railways Cooperation.
					 They included the delegation of the Committee of the Organization of Railways Cooperation led by Chairman Tadeusz Szozda and railways delegations of Russia, China, Latvia, Hungary, Mongolia, Belarus, Azerbaijan, Ukraine, Estonia, Vietnam, Kazakhstan and Poland.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Monday.
					 The members of the group laid bunches of flowers before the statues with boundless reverence for the peerlessly great men who made contributions to strengthening the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and made a bow to them.

articles.title: Chinese Friendship Visiting Group Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Chinese Friendship Visiting Group Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The friendship visiting group of the China National Tourism Administration led by Vice-Chairman Du Yili visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They went round historic relics preserved with much care at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the story about the historic home.
					
					 They visited the revolutionary sites on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 At the end of the visit the head of the delegation said that the President and his family members are the ardent revolutionaries who devoted their all to the country, adding: We came to learn about the great revolutionary spirit, looking round Mangyongdae.
					
					 They also visited the Arch of Triumph, Mirim Riding Club and the Meari Shooting Gallery and laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower.

articles.title: Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1 Marks 30th Anniversary of Field Guidance
articles.content:
Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1 Marks 30th Anniversary of Field Guidance
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- 30 years have passed since leader Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1.
					 His field guidance to Pyongyang Senior High School No. 1 at that time on April 28, Juche 73 (1984) marked a historic occasion in bringing about an epochal turn in the nation's meritocracy.
					
					 Over the past 30 years the school has made great achievements in the education method and meritocracy to bring up the nation's reserve scientific and technological talents.
					
					 It received Order of Kim Il Sung, congratulatory messages of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and won Honored Thrice Red Flag.
					
					 Many teachers were awarded the title of Labor Hero, watches bearing the august name of President Kim Il Sung, commendations of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize and Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize and became people's teachers and merited teachers.
					
					 Among them are more than 70 awardees of academic degrees and titles.
					
					 At least 440 students became winners of the July 15 Honor Student Prize and their ranks are steadily increasing.
					
					 More than 80 students were awarded Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize, Kim Il Sung Children Honor Prize, Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize and Kim Jong Il Children Honor Prize.
					
					 Many students won special places and first places at national math contests, multi-subject contests, program contests and scientific conception contests.
					
					 Students of the school bagged 13 gold medals, 22 silver medals and 9 bronze medals at international math Olympiads which brought together hundreds of excellent students from many countries and regions.

articles.title: DPRK Figure Skaters Prove Successful in Int'l Competition
articles.content:
DPRK Figure Skaters Prove Successful in Int'l Competition
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK figure skaters bagged gold medals in the figure-skating competition of the International Skating Union World Development Trophy 2014.
					 The competition held in Philippines on April 26 brought together more than 60 figure skaters from 15 countries including the DPRK, Argentina, New Zealand, Uzbekistan, Hong Kong of China.
					
					 Ro Yong Myong, Ro Hyang Mi and Kim Un Hyang of the DPRK team placed first in individual men's junior B class, individual women's junior A class and individual women's junior B class events respectively.
					
					 Han Kum Chol and Han Kwang Bom won silver and bronze medals in individual men's youth class event.

articles.title: DPRK Bags Gold Medal in Int'l Competition
articles.content:
DPRK Bags Gold Medal in Int'l Competition
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK player Kang Yong Mi won a gold medal in the women's uneven bars event of the 2014 FIG ART Challenge Cup.
					 The competition held in Croatia from April 24 to 27 brought together more than a hundred players from 29 countries including the DPRK, Switzerland, Sweden, Slovenia and Azerbaijan.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau issued a stamp featuring the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Seen in the stamp are slogan "Let Us Hasten the Final Victory through a Revolutionary Ideological Offensive!", advanced by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the conference, and the emblem of the WPK and letters "Modeling Whole Society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism", the supreme platform of the WPK.
					
					 The stamp reflects the spirit of the conference that calls for holding higher the ideological theory of Juche and opening the gunfire of an ideological campaign and firing the shells concentratedly, successively and at the right targets.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Bureau brought out a stamp in commemoration of the 570th birth anniversary of Hunminjongum (Korean Alphabet).

articles.title: New Kinds of Electronic Pianos Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kinds of Electronic Pianos Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- New kinds of "Sobaeksu"-trademarked electronic pianos (Models 3, 4, 5) have been developed by the Music and Video Electronics J.V.C. in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 The new models are higher in touch sense and far better in timbre than the existing pianos. In particular, the Model 5 for professional can sound as much timbres as the Grand piano.
					
					 Those sectional pianos are equipped with MIDI and batteries.
					
					 Kim In Chol, a section chief of the company, told KCNA that the pianos are on hot demand among art groups, institutions, schools and families.

articles.title: Prospect of Korean Relations Depends on Attitude of S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
Prospect of Korean Relations Depends on Attitude of S. Korean Authorities
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- If the south Korean authorities truly stand for improved inter-Korean relations and peace, they should stop such ridiculous wordplay as talking about "possible mending of the inter-Korean relations" and definitely halt the north-targeted south Korea-U.S.  joint military drills, to begin with, observes Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 The vicious cycle of tension has persisted on the Korean peninsula for the last several decades due to the U.S. and the south Korean authorities, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The joint saber-rattling being staged by the south Korean warmongers together with outside forces as an annual event is a stumbling block lying in the way of improving the inter-Korean relations and achieving peace on the peninsula.
					
					 The above-mentioned war drills should be stopped in south Korea, first of all, in order to create an atmosphere for repairing the inter-Korean relations and provide a peaceful environment on the peninsula.
					
					 With no pretext can they justify the joint military drills with outside forces, the main factor of stoking distrust and confrontation and escalating the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					  The mending of the inter-Korean relations would be unthinkable as long as the above-said saber-rattling against compatriots is going on in south Korea. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should draw a lesson from the catastrophic consequences entailed by their reckless saber-rattling. 
					
					 The prospect of the inter-Korean relations entirely hinges on the attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dynamic and Intensive Ideological Work
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dynamic and Intensive Ideological Work
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday editorially calls on party ideological workers to carry out ideological work in a more dynamic and intensive way.
					 This means bringing the party's line and policies home to the people across the country rapidly and accurately and conducting an intensive ideological campaign by mobilizing all information and agitation forces and means and employing every possible form and method, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea is a revolutionary party which achieved single-minded unity as all its members speak in one and the same voice and advance straight along the path indicated by the Central Committee of the party.
					
					 The single-minded unity is a precious fruition of the dynamic and intensive ideological offensive conducted by the party to make all the party members think and act in unison as intended by the party.
					
					 In recent years we have registered great achievements in the efforts to increase the national capabilities for self-defence and to build an economic power and improve the standard of the people's living under the leadership of the great party.
					
					 The great creation and innovations that brilliantly decorated the onward march at the beginning of Kim Jong Un's glorious era would have been unthinkable apart from the pace-setting role played by the party ideological officials.
					
					 The people's display of their mental power depends on how firm the political principle of the ideological work is and what high role information and agitation play, and the advance of the revolution hinges on the awakening of all service personnel and people. This is a valuable truth taught by history and reality.
					
					 When all the officials and other working people are imbued with Marshal Kim Jong Un's far-reaching intention, operational plan, methods of turning misfortune into a blessing, matchless attack spirit and pluck and encouraged to fully display their strength and wisdom through dynamic and intensive ideological offensive on the ideological front of the party, the great drive for leap forward and innovations will prevail in the country.
					
					 Let's conduct a more dynamic and intensive ideological work as required by the new era of the Juche revolution! This should be a mode of activities for all party ideological workers and their practice under any circumstances.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Pushing Forward Land Management
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Pushing Forward Land Management
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article calls on all the party members and other working people to turn out in the land management as one with ardent patriotism.
					 Land management is a work of eternal value for face-lifting the country as befitting a thriving socialist country, a noble work for providing the people with better living conditions and a patriotic work for guaranteeing the happiness of all generations to come, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul to successfully spruce up the country, paying deep attention to land management all their lives.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un has wisely led the drive to make the country, the legacy left by the Generalissimos, richer and stronger and turn it into a socialist paradise where people enjoy all well-beings.
					
					 A lot of edifices have sprung up across the country for the people and the afforestation has made brisk headway, bringing about great progress in the work to convert the whole country into forests and greenery. This is a shining fruition brought about by the energetic leadership of the Marshal.
					
					 It is the fixed will of the Marshal to bring about a drastic turn in land management and thus turn the country into a people's paradise where the true nature of socialism is preserved and its flavor is strongly felt.
					
					 When all people devote their patriotic enthusiasm to the work for providing the generations to come with rich natural resources and beautiful living conditions with the revolutionary outlook on the life which calls for living not for today but for tomorrow, our country will shine more brilliantly as a picturesque socialist paradise.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Denounces Massacre of Civilians before and after Korean War
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Denounces Massacre of Civilians before and after Korean War
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Council of Organizations for Proper Settlement of the Past Crimes made up of civic and public organizations including the Solidarity Meeting of Organizations to Honor Memory of Martyrs for National Democracy held a press conference in Seoul on April 25 and denounced the massacre of civilians committed before and after the Korean war, according to internet newspaper of south Korea Thongil News.
					 The council made public an open letter addressed to the U.S. president at the press conference.
					
					 The letter said that lots of Koreans were brutally killed before and after the Korean war but the truth has been covered up for more than half a century.
					
					 The bereaved families of those who fell victim to the mass killings of civilians unprecedented in history in its cruelty are still suffering from agony, the letter said.
					
					 The wartime massacres were perpetrated in an organized and planned way, in particular, the letter noted, adding:
					
					 The south Korean "government" has concealed the truth of the case and destroyed evidence by abusing power for decades and the U.S. has kept mum about it.
					
					 The U.S. should clarify the truth behind the mass killings of civilians before and after the war.
					
					 The organization thrust the open letter to the U.S. embassy at the end of the press conference.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Are Entirely to Blame for Sinking of Ferry
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Are Entirely to Blame for Sinking of Ferry
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea released a commentary on April 24 condemning the arch criminals responsible for the sinking of ferry Sewol.
					 Had the Lee Myung Bak regime have not removed the disaster control system, the damage caused by the sinking of the ferry would have been minimized, the commentary noted.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime formed the control headquarters a few days after the sinking of the ferry, disclosing its incompetence, the commentary held.
					
					 What the present regime did was blocking the families of the victims from thronging to Chongwadae, it said, adding it is not exaggeration to claim that the incompetence of the authorities led to the death of children.
					
					 The commentary accused Park of evading the responsibility and persistently blaming others.
					
					 It urged the Park regime to disclose all information about the case to fully clarify the doubt about it.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Driving Korean Relations into Catastrophe
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Driving Korean Relations into Catastrophe
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China released a statement on April 24 denouncing the Park Geun Hye regime for pushing the north-south relations to a catastrophe.
					 The statement said: The inter-Korean relations made a good start at the outset of the year thanks to a positive initiative of the DPRK. But this process was derailed by the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers, pushing the relations between the north and south to the brink of a war.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations remain in the state of confrontation due to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, the policy aimed to meet its interests through the continued division of Korea, and the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen pursued by the pro-U.S. lackeys in south Korea who kowtow to it, staking their fate on it.
					
					 Park should make a bold option to roll back the anachronistic policy of confrontation as early as possible, bearing in mind that her policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen would not help garner "people's support" but spark off nationwide resistance. 
					
					 The statement urged her to properly understand the desire of the nation and sincerely opt for developing the north-south relations before it is too late.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated at DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated at DPRK Missions Abroad 
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Kimjongilia exhibitions, photo exhibitions, film shows, friendship meetings, receptions and other events took place at DPRK missions abroad from April 3 to 15 on the occasion the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun). They included DPRK missions in Beijing and Hong Kong of China, Nakhodka of Russia, Laos, Indonesia, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Nepal, Cambodia, Kuwait, Uzbekistan, Bulgaria, Switzerland, Italy, Spain, France, Sweden, Poland, UK, Nigeria, Equatorial Guinea, Egypt, Angola and Uganda. 
					 Displayed on the front walls of the venues of the events were portraits of smiling Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and full-length pictures of Kim Il Sung standing together with Kim Jong Il. Seen standing before the portraits and pictures were floral baskets and bouquets. 
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting immortal exploits of the Generalissimos and Marshal Kim Jong Un, famous works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu, immortal Kimjongilias praising the great man, and publications introducing Songun Korea. 
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "Pyongyang Today". 
					
					 The chairman of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia said that Kim Il Sung is not only the eternal President of the DPRK but also a benevolent teacher of the world progressives including the Indonesian people. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain expressed the belief that the exploits Kim Il Sung performed for the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence would be immortal. 
					
					 The acting secretary general of the Uganda National Resistance Movement praised Kim Il Sung as the greatest man who founded the immortal Juche idea and defeated formidable U.S. and Japanese imperialism in one generation. 
					
					 The deputy director-general of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the UN said that Kim Il Sung published the Theses on the Socialist Rural Question 50 years ago, adding: This makes one know well how he worked heart and soul to improve the people's living standard.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Introduced by Angolan Paper
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Introduced by Angolan Paper
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Angolan paper Continente on April 18 carried a brief biography of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The paper carried photos documenting revolutionary activities of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun).
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event on April 9 carried articles under the bannerline "On the occasion of the 102nd birth anniversary of the great President Kim Il Sung", illustrated with his photo.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Eternal sun" said not only the Korean people but also progressive humankind are celebrating the Day of the Sun with splendor every year.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The august name of the President means the sun.
					
					 His noble personality and warm humanity impressed a lot of people in the world.
					
					 He met over 70 000 foreigners all his life.
					
					 Although he passed away, his idea and cause are shining like the sun.
					
					 The Guinean paper Horoya on April 10 carried an article praising the undying exploits the President performed for people all his life, accompanied with a portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The British paper The New Worker on April 4 in an article titled "Revolutionary solute to Comrade Kim Il Sung!" praised him as the great revolutionary who dedicated his whole life to the happiness of the people and victory of the world revolution.
					
					 His revolutionary cause is being successfully carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un, it added.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Marked by Foreign Political Parties, Organizations
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Marked by Foreign Political Parties, Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Special write-ups were posted by political parties and organizations of various countries on their websites on April 9 and 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun) and the 21st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 The Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation posted on its website an article praising the undying exploits and noble revolutionary life of Kim Il Sung who founded the Juche idea, defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialism in one generation and turned the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association in an article said that the President led to victories the anti-Japanese armed struggle and the Fatherland Liberation War, successfully steered social revolution of several stages and wisely guided the broad masses so that they might positively participate in all social and political activities.
					
					 The German MS Travel Company in an article titled "Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il and DPRK today" noted that he performed the great exploits which will shine long in history by pursuing his unique Songun politics.
					
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website an article titled "On occasion of the Day of the Sun, Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism". The article said:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un formulated the revolutionary idea of the President and Kim Jong Il as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, a historic event of great significance for progressives who are struggling for independence and socialism.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il posted an article and a photo introducing the Tower of the Juche Idea.

articles.content:
Otorgado titulo de vicemariscal de EPC a Hwang Pyong So

articles.title: Jamas perdonaremos a desafiantes a dignidad de RPDC, insiste CRPP
articles.content:
Jamas perdonaremos a desafiantes a dignidad de RPDC, insiste CRPP
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el dia 27 una declaracion de condena a la visita de los dias 25 y 26 del presidente norteamericano Obama al Sur de Corea.
					En actualidad, todo el territorio surcoreano se ha hecho una casa en duelo por el caso de hundimiento de barco de pasajeros, recuerda la nota y prosigue:
					
					Bajo tal condicion, Obama debia aplazar o dejar pendiente su visita al Sur de Corea si tenia la minima etica y la moralidad.
					
					Sin embargo, solo con el objetivo de intensificar la connivencia anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el amo gringo y su sirvienta organizaron su visita de caracter criminal sin hacer caso de la tristeza de la poblacion surcoreana, ocasion en la cual difamaron, amenazaron y chantajearon perversamente la RPDC.
					
					La actitud de Park Geun-hye, mostrada esta vez ante Obama, parece a una parvula necia que mendiga a los gangsteres a golpear a alguien o a una prostituta que atenta a otros entregando su cuerpo a su chulo.
					
					 Asi, Park respondio con la guerra a nuestra pregunta si ella desea la reunificacion pacifica basada en la reconciliacion intercoreana o la guerra segun el enfrentamiento de regimenes. Ademas puso al desnudo que su "proceso de confianza" es la misma politica conflictiva que el traidor Lee Myung Bak. Tambien declaro a todo el mundo su posicion de enfrentarse hasta el fin con la RPDC y llevar a la fase catastrofica la situacion sin tomar en consideracion la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Park no dijo ni una palabra de las armas nucleares de EE.UU., pero cuestiono con frenesi las de su connacional aceptando asi toda  demanda agresiva de su amo. Con tal proceder ella misma revelo su naturaleza como connotada vendepatria, asquerosa consoladora de EE.UU. y prostituta antinacional.
					
					Park visito por primera vez en calidad de gobernante junto con Obama a la "comandancia de las fuerzas aliadas Sur de Corea-EE.UU." ocasion en la cual actuo como loca vociferando del "disuasivo anti-RPDC" y la "contramedida resuelta a la provocacion del Norte" y causo un escandalo coqueteando demasiado a Obama vistiendose impropiamente al aire funeral.
					
					La presente farsa anti-RPDC del amo gringo y su sirvienta provoca censura de todas las personas siendo un entreacto satirico inhallable en este mundo terraqueo.
					
					El resultado de presente viaje de Obama comprueba que fueron correctos el juicio y la determinacion de la RPDC de enfrentarse con EE.UU., enemigo jurado no con las palabras sino con las fuerzas y de sacar la cuenta final con la gran batalla total nuclear. Al mismo tiempo hace redoblar la voluntad de seguir por el camino optado y declarado por si mismo.
					
					Esta vez se revelo patentemente la naturaleza de Park.
					
					Se hizo mas claro que ya no existe otro remedio para Park y que no hay nada de esperar en las relaciones intercoreanas mientras que ella permanezca en Chongwadae.
					
					Park, acostumbrada al servilismo a grandes potencias y a la confrontacion fratricida, solamente suena con el enfrentamiento de regimenes.
					
					Le pasara a Park el mismo destino de su padre Park Chung Hee que perdio tragicamente la vida por su amo gringo y la opinion publica mientras gritaba la "unificacion basada en la victoria sobre el comunismo" y la "unificacion basada en el exterminio al comunismo".
					
					La RPDC no perdonara nunca a quienes se atrevan a desafiar a la dignidad y el regimen y la linea de desarrollo paralelo de la RPDC.

articles.title: CDN de RPDC expone la posicion de principios sobre la visita de Obama al Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CDN de RPDC expone la posicion de principios sobre la visita de Obama al Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ACNC) -- En relacion con que el presidente norteamericano Obama realizo del dia 25 al 26 una visita al Sur de Corea, el portavoz del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 28 una declaracion.
					En una palabra, esta visita de Obama no pasa de ser una payasada anormal y extrana que se realizo por la solicitud insistente y coquetona de su lacaya, empantanada en atolladero debido a su dominacion fascista "Yusin" de version moderna e infames politicas antipopulares, comienza la nota y prosigue:
					
					No vale la pena discutir detalle por detalle el comportamiento repugnante del amo y su titere, pero hay que tomar por grave el siniestro acto verbal de Obama.
					
					Antes del presente viaje, hemos aconsejado a Obama que actue con prudencia como responsable por el alivio de tension y el aseguramiento de paz en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Durante su viaje, Obama realizo la cumbre, la rueda de prensa conjunta, la inspeccion a la "comandancia de las fuerzas combinadas" EE.UU.-Sur de Corea y otros actos acusando sin parar a la RPDC e instigando a los titeres surcoreanos a la confrontacion anti-RPDC.
					
					Ademas, pretextando las actividades nucleares autodefensivas y el lanzamiento de cohetes de la RPDC, acordo el recrudecimiento de la "sancion" internacional y la "cooperacion anti-Norte de Corea" y el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles y la posposicion del traspaso del mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra, lo cual expuso a todo el mundo el objetivo principal de su visita.
					
					Con motivo de que el mandatario norteamericano, caudillo de elaboracion y ejecucion de la politica sobre la RPDC, se porto mal hasta en el Sur de Corea acusandola injustamente, el portavoz del CDN de la RPDC expone la siguiente posicion de principios:
					
					Primero, antes de cuestionar nuestras justas armas nucleares, EE.UU. debera reflexionar profundamente en sus procedimientos criminales de ayer y hoy que acarrearon a la humanidad la catastrofe nuclear.
					
					Obama volvio a hablar tanto de la "doctrina de no reconocer ni tolerar la posesion de armas nucleares del Norte de Corea" parloteando que las armas nucleares de la RPDC constituyen una "amenaza directa" a los paises aliados y a su pais.
					
					El problema nuclear, que es calamidad y rompecabezas de hoy, se genero precisamente por EE.UU.
					
					Tambien nuestras armas nucleares son producto de persistente amenaza y chantaje  nucleares de EE.UU.
					
					Sin embargo, el imperio norteamericano se porta descaradamente ocultando sus pasados de haber causado el problema nuclear de la RPDC.
					
					Reafirmamos que hemos poseido las armas nucleares no para obtener el reconocimiento ni el permiso de alguien y que nuestras armas nucleares no son producto de regateo para cualquiera negociacion economica.
					
					Antes de cuestionar a otros, EE.UU. debera aprender primero la costumbre de meditar y ajustar cuenta sobre si mismo.
					
					Sera favorable para si mismo portarse sabiamente  interpretando bien el significado del proverbio; El que al cielo escupe, en la cara le cae.
					
					Segundo, EE.UU. debe recordar primero la corrupta sociedad de si mismo, antes de acusar a la RPDC de la inexistente "provocacion", "amenaza" y problema de "DDHH".
					
					Durante toda su estancia en el Sur de Corea, Obama no se canso de cuestionar con Park Geun-hye hasta el problema de "derechos humanos" de la RPDC mientras insistian en la "provocacion y la amenaza" provenientes de esta.
					
					Entonces, ?usaran ellos las palabras "provocacion y amenaza" conociendo bien el concepto de estas expresiones?
					
					EE.UU. califica de "provocacion y amenaza" la defensa legitima de la RPDC para salvaguardar el sagrado territorio propio desde la agresion de las fuerzas foraneas y de justos sus actos belicos que comete en el territorio ajeno muy lejos, con lo cual se han revelado con mas claridad la logica de bandido de ese imperio y su temperamento de invertir los hechos.
					
					Pasa lo mismo en el problema de "DDHH" de alguien.
					
					DDHH es precisamente la soberania.
					
					El hombre, privado de soberania, es igual a un muerto aunque este vivo.
					
					Ninguna riqueza material ni la vida opulenta puede reemplazar la soberania, esto es la verdad comprobada por la larga historia de la humanidad y la dura realidad del mundo actual.
					
					EE.UU. y sus seguidores deben tener bien presente que la RPDC no es igual a los paises del Medio Oriente o la Peninsula Balcanica que se derrumbaron ante su ofensiva de "DDHH". 
					
					Tercero, No seria mal tener en cuenta que el intento de ocupar para siempre la Peninsula Coreana es una ambicion anacronica que acelerara la destruccion vergonzosa de EE.UU.
					
					Esta vez, Obama demostro otra vez su temperamento de lobo feroz que no suelta nunca el jamon mordido.
					
					Es que urgio a los titeres surcoreanos revisar el periodo y las condiciones de traspaso del mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra, previsto para finales del ano 2015.
					
					EE.UU. pretendio mantener a toda costa ese mando para no perder su punto estrategico: el Sur de Corea ocupado por casi 70 anos.
					
					Por esta razon, hablo tanto de la "amenaza sostenida" de la RPDC y abogo por el "disuasivo de guerra".
					
					Es ambicion nunca realizable el intento agresivo de EE.UU. de ocupar perpetuamente el suelo surcoreano.
					
					Anunciamos claramente nuestra posicion a EE.UU. que desconoce todavia demasiadas cosas de su rival.
					
					Cada vez que se torne mas brutal la campana hostil anti-RPDC, se hara mas fuerte la represalia de esta.
					
					Le convendria a Obama justipreciar la situacion y examinar con serenidad lo que va a conseguir con su brutal politica hostil anticoreana y lo que va a perder con la misma.
					
					Le aconsejamos una vez mas que no pierda la oportunidad de encontrarse en el trono de la Casa Blanca.

articles.title: Vicepremier coreano se reune con su homologo ruso
articles.content:
Vicepremier coreano se reune con su homologo ruso
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 28 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre el vicepremier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ro Tu Chol y el vicepremier del gobierno ruso y representante plenipotenciario del presidente de la Federacion Rusa acreditado en el distrito federal del Lejano Oriente, Yuri Trutnev.
					Participaron por la parte coreana Ri Ryong Nam, ministro de Comercio Exterior, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el consul general en Najodka Im Chon Il,  y otros funcionarios concernientes y por la  rusa, el representante plenipotenciario del presidente y su comitiva junto con el embajador Alexandr Timonin y otros miembros de la embajada de Rusia en Corea.
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron sus criterios sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de cooperacion economica entre los dos paises y otros temas de interes mutuo.
					
					Con anterioridad, hubo las conversaciones privadas entre Ro Tu Chol y Yuri Trutnev.

articles.title: Gobierno de RPDC ofrece banquete en honor de vicepremier ruso y su comitiva
articles.content:

Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 28 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae un banquete en honor de Yuri Trutnev, vicepremier del gobierno ruso y representante plenipotenciario del presidente de la Federacion Rusa acreditado en el distrito federal del lejano oriente y su comitiva, de visita en Corea.

					Estuvieron presentes el vicepremier coreano, Ro Tu Chol, el ministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Ryong Nam, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					En la ocasion hubo intervenciones.

articles.title: Gobierno ruso dona a RPDC camiones de bomberos
articles.content:
Gobierno ruso dona a RPDC camiones de bomberos
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Federacion Rusa dono a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los camiones de bomberos.
					Tuvo lugar el dia 28 en esta capital la ceremonia de donacion.
					
					Participaron en la ocasion el vicepremier Ro Tu Chol, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro Kim Sung Bom y otros funcionarios y bomberos del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo, el vicepremier del gobierno ruso y representante plenipotenciario del presidente de la Federacion Rusa acreditado en el distrito federal del Lejano Oriente, Yuri Trutnev, y su comitiva, de visita en Corea, el embajador Alexandr Timonin y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica rusa en Corea.
					
					Los oradores expresaron la esperanza de que esos vehiculos, que reflejan la sinceridad y la amistad del pueblo ruso, desempenen papel importante en el mantenimiento de la seguridad del pueblo coreano
					
					Luego de entregado el certificado de donacion, los participantes pasaron revista a los camiones.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo sobre cooperacion economica y comercial entre RPDC y Rusia
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo sobre cooperacion economica y comercial entre RPDC y Rusia
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado este lunes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae el acuerdo sobre la cooperacion economica y comercial entre el Ministerio de Comercio Exterior de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el gobierno de la region de Amur de la Federacion Rusa. 
					En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana el vicepremier Ro Tu Chol, el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el consul general en Najodka Im Chon Il y otros funcionarios correspondientes, y por la rusa, el vicepremier del gobierno ruso y representante plenipotenciario del presidente de la Federacion Rusa acreditado en el distrito federal del Lejano Oriente, Yuri Trutnev, y su comitiva, el embajador Alexandr Timonin y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica rusa en Corea. 
					
					Ri Ryong Nam y el gobernador de Amur, Oleg Kozhemyako, suscribieron el documento.
					
					Por otra parte, quedo rubricado un documento sobre la cooperacion de sector de transporte ferroviario entre el Ministerio del Ferrocarril de la RPDC y la Compania Cientifico-Industrial "Mostovik" de Rusia.
